title: 2017 ingame ping meter stuck
body:
So, as long as i can remember in 2017 my ping meter just says 34... never moves at all. some times im lagging out to the point where i rubber band if i move left right left right. with say 1 step in between. u see the way the character model turns around but moves facing the wrong way. 
then its back to normal. but u cant see any spikes in ping graph.. its just 34 . 

also sometimes I notice skill shots like say LUX snare. will get be twice the range from where i seen the animation end... 
its kinda infuriating .

anyone else notice this?

replies.body: Sounds like packet loss to me, which doesn't always show up on the ping meter since your ping isn't technically going up but rather you are losing data between you and Riot. That said, I'm no tech person so you'll have to wait for Seph on this one to give you the common fixes.

my vdsl router max mtu is 1492, my maximum transmission unit  in windows(10 64bit) is 1500 (last time i checked)
have restored default from tcp-optimizer (game response - high etc) 
tracert in cmd and in winmtr both reach hop 8 and everything after times out.  all other results 0% loss.
i have interleaving turned off on my connection, i have not changed tcpackfrequency or tcpnodelay in reg edit. 

Network performance (?): Latency: 200 ms, Loss: 0.0% + 
 TCP connection setup latency (?): 200ms +     
 Background measurement of network health (?): no transient outages +     
 Network bandwidth (?): Upload 800 Kbit/s
You'd be better off passing that to Seph, I have no idea what most of that means.

oh sorry i replied to you, 

he can see it no doubt.

Could you do the following for me,

* [Switch to a public DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq5)
* [Download WinMTR](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/files/WinMTR-v092.zip/download) and run a traceroute to the following IP. (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)
  * 103.240.227.5
* Once adequate time has passed, stop the traceroute, export your results as text.
* Run the [ICSI netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/).
* Post back with a link to your WinMTR results (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this) and the direct url to your ICSI netalyzr results.
